en.value: Talking about our occupations - Verbs "to do, to work, to study"
In this lesson, we'll learn how to ask someone what job they do and say what jobs we do. We'll learn things like:
Read and listen to the expression.
Memorise the word(s) and listen to the example.
When talking about a place we work in, we say: "I work in" + "a" + place of work.
Memorise the word(s) and listen to the example.
When we are talking about a field of work, we say: "I work in" + field of work.
As we’ve just seen, when we talk about our place or field of work, we say “I work in…“. However, when we give our job title we use the verb “to be”, so we say:
The doctor works at the hospital.
Select the job titles in the examples below.
Listen to the dialogue and fill in the gaps.
Oliver and Ava are talking about their jobs.
I work in a [k]restaurant[/k], but I'm also a [k]student[/k]!
Oliver is a student  and works in a cafe at the same time.
Select the words in the correct order.
Listen and select the correct word(s) to fill the gap.
Match the beginning and end of each sentence.
Select the correct words to fill the gaps.
Fill in the gaps with the correct letters.
Fill in the gap using the image.
Match the pairs of words / phrases.
Fill in the gap using the audio.
What do you do? Answer in as much detail as you can.
Grammar: To work, to do, to study
In this unit, we're going to take another look at the verbs "to do" and "to work", as well as introduce the verb "to study". Look at the examples below.
Select the different forms of "to do", "to work" and "to study".
These three verbs all remain the same, except when they are paired with "he/she":
Listen and select the correct form of the verb to fill the gap.
Select the correct form of the verb to fill the gap.
This is the "he/she" form of "to work".
This is the "he/she" form of "to do".
Now that we have seen the different forms of the verbs "to do", "to work" and "to study", let's have a go at recognising them in a dialogue. To recap, here are the different forms of the three verbs:

Hannah and Liam are discussing their occupations.

("sister" = sister)
I [k]work[/k] in marketing. How about you?
They [k]do not|don't[/k] work in a cafe.
Select the correct word(s) to fill the gap.
Type the correct form of "to work".
Type the correct form of "to study".
